intro: Appendicula pilosa var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy appendicula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its growth habit is low and spreading, making it a suitable ground cover in suitable climates.
